name: Dataset
overview:
This class allows you interact with BigQuery.

First, install google-cloud with npm:

$ npm install --save google-cloud

If you are running your app on Google Compute Engine, you won't need to worry about supplying connection configuration options to google-cloudâ€” we figure that out for you.

However, if you're running your app elsewhere, you will need to provide project details to authenticate API requests.

Compute Engine

var gcloud = require('google-cloud'); var bigquery = gcloud.bigquery();

Elsewhere

var gcloud = require('google-cloud'); var bigquery = gcloud.bigquery({ projectId: 'grape-spaceship-123', keyFilename: '/path/to/keyfile.json' });

The full set of options which can be passed to google-cloud are outlined in our Authentication guide.

methods.name: Dataset
methods.description: Interact with your BigQuery dataset. Create a Dataset instance with bigquery#createDataset or bigquery#dataset.

examples.code: var dataset = bigquery.dataset('institutions');

examples.caption: If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.

examples.code: dataset.exists(function(err, exists) {});

examples.caption: If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request.

methods.name: get
methods.description:
Get a dataset if it exists.

You may optionally use this to "get or create" an object by providing an object with autoCreate set to true. Any extra configuration that is normally required for the create method must be contained within this object as well.

examples.caption: If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.

params.name: options.autoCreate
params.description: • Automatically create the object if it does not exist. Default: false

examples.code: dataset.getMetadata(function(err, metadata, apiResponse) {});

examples.caption: If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request.

methods.name: setMetadata
methods.description: Sets the metadata of the Dataset object.

examples.caption: If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request.

methods.name: createQueryStream
methods.description:
Run a query scoped to your dataset as a readable object stream.

See bigquery#createQueryStream for full documentation of this method.

methods.name: createTable
methods.description: Create a table given a tableId or configuration object.

examples.caption: If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.

params.name: options.schema
params.description: • A comma-separated list of name:type pairs. Valid types are "string", "integer", "float", "boolean", and "timestamp". If the type is omitted, it is assumed to be "string". Example: "name:string, age:integer". Schemas can also be specified as a JSON array of fields, which allows for nested and repeated fields. See a Table resource for more detailed information.

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request

examples.caption: Delete the dataset, only if it does not have any tables.
examples.code: dataset.delete(function(err, apiResponse) {});

examples.caption: Delete the dataset and any tables it contains.
examples.code: dataset.delete({ force: true }, function(err, apiResponse) {});

examples.caption: If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.

params.name: options.force
params.description: • Force delete dataset and all tables. Default: false.

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request

examples.caption: To control how many API requests are made and page through the results manually, set autoPaginate to false.
If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.

params.name: query.maxApiCalls
params.description: • Maximum number of API calls to make.

params.name: query.pageToken
params.description: • Token returned from a previous call, to request the next page of results.

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request

params.name: callback.tables
params.description: • The list of tables from your Dataset.

methods.name: getTablesStream
methods.description: List all or some of the bigquery/table objects in your project as a readable object stream.

examples.caption: If you anticipate many results, you can end a stream early to prevent unnecessary processing and API requests.

params.name: query
params.description: • Configuration object. See bigquery/dataset#getTables for a complete list of options.

methods.name: query
methods.description:
Run a query scoped to your dataset.

See bigquery#query for full documentation of this method.

examples.code: var institutions = dataset.table('institution_data');
